document.docAuthor: Özbek, Hasan Hüseyin, Bal, Durmuş Ali & Doğan, Salih
document.docTitle: Longicheles ayyildizi Özbek, Bal & Doğan, 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the genus Longicheles Valle, 1953 from the Kelkit Valley, Turkey, with redescription Longicheles lagrecai (Valle, 1963) (Acari: Macrochelidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the genus Longicheles Valle, 1953 from the Kelkit Valley, Turkey, with redescription Longicheles lagrecai (Valle, 1963) (Acari: Macrochelidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Dorsal setae
j 5
,
j 6
,
z 1
,
z 5
,
z 6
,
J 2
and
J 5
smooth, other setae pilose; bases of
j 1
separated from each other; anterior ends of peritremes surpassing bases of setae
z 1
; ventri-anal shield wider than long, length of pre-anal setae
Jv 1
, 25–30,
Jv 2
, about 45 ,
Jv 3
, 35–50,
Zv 1
, 55–60,
Zv 2
, 50–65.

Specimens examined. Holotype female, Turkey , Tokat, Niksar,
40 ° 32 ' 03'' N
,
36 ° 53 ' 08'' E
, alt. 408 m ,
27 April 2011
, from litter. Paratypes . one female, Turkey , Sivas, Suşehri,
40 ° 24 ' 25 '' N
,
37 ° 13 ' 02'' E
, alt. 451 m , 0
1 November 2008
, from litter under
Ulmus
sp ; one female, Turkey , Tokat, Niksar,
40 ° 25 ' 44 '' N
,
37 ° 07' 47 '' E
, alt. 494 m ,
10 June 2011
, from litter; one female, Turkey , Köse,
40 ° 16 ' 59 '' N
,
39 ° 37 ' 52 '' E
, alt. 1869 m , 0
1 May 2012
, from litter under
Pinus
sp.; one female, Turkey , Köse,
40 ° 04' 46 '' N
,
39 ° 02' 39 '' E
, alt. 1329 m , 0
1 May 2012
, from litter under Coryllus sp.; one female, Turkey , Giresun, Alucra-Çamoluk,
40 ° 15 ' 15 '' N
,
38 ° 49 ' 48 '' E
, alt. 1825 m , 0
1 May 2012
, from moss.

Description. Female. Dorsum (
Fig. 12
). Dorsal shield 840–980 long, 470–490 wide at the level of setae
r 4
, oblong, covered with punctate ornamentation, posteriorly also reticulate; setae
j 5
,
j 6
,
z 1
,
z 5
,
z 6
,
J 2
and
J 5
aciculate or needle-like, other setae pilose; bases of
j 1
separate from each other, anterior end of peritremes surpassing bases of setae
z 1
; length of setae:
j 1
, 35–40;
j 5
, 85–90;
j 6
, 70–75;
z 1
, 110–115;
z 5
, 60–70;
z 6
, 55–75;
J 2
, 80–95;
J 5
, 75– 85.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 12 – 17.
Longicheles ayyildizi
sp. nov. ,
female. 12. dorsal shield; 13. ventral shields; 14. gnathosoma; 15. epistome; 16. chelicera; 17. tarsus II. Scale bar=200 µm for 12 and 13, 100 µm for 14–17.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gnathosoma . Four pairs of hypostomal setae present, all smooth and needle-like; deutosternal grove with five rows of denticles. Corniculi slender and long, not reaching base of palp genu (
Fig. 14
). Palp apotele 3 -tined. Epistome 100 long in holotype , median process with lateral outgrowth at base, narrowed and bifurcate apically (
Fig. 15
). Fixed digit of chelicerae 120–130 long at level of dorsal seta, dorsal seta smooth and blade-like; moveable digit about 170 long with 6–7 small teeth and one large subterminal tooth. Arthrodial brush short (
Figs 16
, 31 ).

Legs . Chaetotaxy normal for the genus
Longicheles
. Coxae I with a pair of smooth setae, coxae II and III with a pair of pilose setae, coxae IV with a pilose seta. Tarsus II as in
Fig. 17
.
Etymology. The species is named for Turkish acarologist Dr. Nusret Ayyildiz of Erciyes University, Kayseri.

Notes . This species has been found inn litter under
Pinus
sp. and Coryllus sp., and in moss and litter at altitudes between 408 and 1869 m .
Longicheles ayyildizi
is clearly separated from other species of
L . mandibularis
,
L . hortorum
,
L . longulus
,
L . bulgaricus
,
L . longisetosus
,
L . ilvana
and
L . ozkani
, but it is similar to
L . lagrecai
,
L . bianchii
,
L . ranzii
. It differs from
L . lagrecai
by the short pre-anal setae, ventri-anal shield wider than long, ornamentation of the sternal shield, dentition of the cheliceral digits, and the shape of the epistome. Also,
L . ayyildizi
is easily separated from
L . ranzii
and
L . bianchii
by with setae
j 2
pilose,
J 5
needle-like (pilose for
L . ranzii
),
z 1
110–115 long (about 80 for
L . ranzii
and
L . bianchii
), different dentition of the cheliceral digits, and the shape of the epistome.
